text:
ng
Benefits of exclusive breastfeeding and continued breastfeeding to newborn, infants and children
 ∙ It provides complete nutritional staple to the infant up to the age of six months, up to half of nutritional 
requirements between 6-12 months and up to one-third, between 12 and 24 months.
 ∙ Breastmilk contains adequate calories and provides the right kind of proteins, fats, lactose, vitamins, iron and 
other minerals, enzymes, and water in the amounts necessary for the baby.
